page.title: 05BRADLEY DAIRY FARM ROUTINE
page.content: The dairy cows graze out in the fields from mid-April to mid-October. The cows graze a strip of land at a time, they are kept in place by an electric fence. After a month they are moved into another field. In the winter the cows are kept in sheds and are fed on silage and protein enriched cattle cake. They eat about 4Okg per day. The amount of cattle feed they have is increased when they give more milk after the calves are born. Milking is carried out twice a day. From 7am until 9am and then 4.3Opm to 6.15pm. They are fed on corn whilst in the milking parlour. They are clever and bang the container with their heads to get more corn whilst they are milked by the automatic machines. All the milk is sold to the Milk Marketing Board.
